feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 7:30PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Thunderstorms From The Canning River East Tonight... Strong thunderstorms from the Canning River east will continue through late tonight. Frequent lightning, brief heavy rain, winds gusting to 30 mph and hail will occur. Some of the hail could be up to 1 inch in diameter. People in higher terrain should move to lower elevations to avoid the lightning. People in steep terrain
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northeastern Brooks Range

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 7:27PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Thunderstorms Near The ALCAN Border Tonight... Strong thunderstorms along the Canadian Border will continue through late tonight. Frequent lightning, brief heavy rain, winds gusting to 30 mph and hail will occur. Some of the hail could be up to 1 inch in diameter. People in higher terrain such as the Eastern Brooks Range and the Taylor and Top of the World Highway
entry.cap:areaDesc: Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 7:27PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water Along The Tanana River Into Next Weekend... High water continues along glacially fed rivers draining the Alaska Range, including the Delta, Nenana and Tanana Rivers. Warm temperatures continue to cause enhanced glacial and high elevation snowmelt runoff. Low lying areas along these rivers may fill with water. Increased river bank erosion will occur.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Middle Tanana Valley
